Text.content:
The chapter about formatters has shown that XML contents in the actual sense contain textual and image data that are visually shown on a website. There was one exception though, the layout content describing a responsive page layout, which did not directly produce visual output in the end but was the configuration for a responsive page structure. The idea of using contents for configuration purposes is continued by dynamic functions.

Dynamic function (function_config) in OpenCms is an XML content type as well, namely, a built-in configuration type that does not display any user authored content but is the configuration for any kind of functionality that we want the content editor to drag and drop onto a web page. For example, we like to social sharing buttons. Dynamic functions are stored in modules in a directory called functions/. Similar to formatters they consist of a function JSP and a function configuration, where the names of the files as a convention should be named in the same way besides the suffix and should inform about what the function does, for example:

/functions/current-date.jsp
/functions/current-date.xml
